snippet: Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac agreed to resist any speculative deal that would turn the complex into a luxury enclave, Senator Charles E. Schumer said.
abstract: New York Sen Charles E Schumer announces that mortgage finance companies Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac have agreed to resist any speculative deal that would turn Stuyvesant Town-Peter Cooper Village residential complex in Manhattan into luxury enclave; battle has been ongoing to preserve increasingly rare oasis for middle-class families in borough.
lead_paragraph: Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac agreed to resist any speculative deal that would turn the complex into a luxury enclave, Senator Charles E. Schumer said.

headline.main: Lenders Enlisted in Effort to Preserve Stuyvesant Town for the Middle Class
headline.print_headline: Lenders Enlisted in Effort to Preserve Stuyvesant Town for the Middle Class

keywords.value: Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corp (Freddie Mac)
keywords.name: organizations
